channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked drain, 24th October
item.description:
Blocked drain causing flooding in the street. Outside number 9 Glamorgan road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Glamorgan Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation on central reservation, 24th October
item.description:
This has been reported previously. A traffic hazard, obscuring line of sight etc Previous report has not been actioned apparently due to CBC litter pick. Report this time is simply to remove vegetation which is solely the responsibility of GCC.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Tewkesbury Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big puddle, 24th October
item.description:
Big puddle every time it rains along the pathway outside 66 Nine Elms Road. When it’s too much water it runs onto my drive way and floods my garage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Streetlight out., 23rd October
item.description:
Streetlight 205 is dead, and the nearby ones are shaded by trees. Very dark on the uneven pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34 Sandford Mill Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Pavement subsidence- water not draining, 23rd October
item.description:
The pavement outside of Boots has subsided so when it now rains a very large pool of water is created - see picture. This spot is also the heart of the city centre

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 192 194 High Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road level to high and water not draining correctly, 23rd October
item.description:
The road has been resurfaced without it being done correctly. Prior to the road being resurfaced it was okay. The issue it’s causing is when it rains heavy excess water off the road is filling up the driveways causing potential threats of flooding. Attention to the road level or drainage is required.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Tewkesbury Road, Down Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The surface of Cowper Road deteriorating, 23rd October
item.description:
Multiple potholes here, filled with water today. I just got soaked by DHL van because parked cars on the other side of the road force them into these potholes. Some over 7.5cm deep

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged by broadband company, 22nd October
item.description:
Damaged to pavement between 4 and 6 leinster close, caused by heavy equipment

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Leinster Close, Cheltenham

item.title: Previous report not fully fixed., 21st October
item.description:
I previously reported overgrown vegetation to the public footpath between Hunters Road and Stoke Road. This has been reported as fixed (ref 11379330) but, as the photo shows, there is a substantial layer of ivy covering the still covering the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 19 Hunters Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potentially dangerous wobbly paving stone, 21st October
item.description:
There are a series of cracked paving stones on the pedestrianised area of The Promenade outside House of Fraser but whilst the council appear to have highlighted one broken slab, its the neighbouring one - that is very wobbly and sticking up - which is potentially dangerous. I have enclosed the window from HOF for reference and proximity

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 48a Regent Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
2 drains have lifted sticking up dangerously, on the corner of Milton Rd.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 55 Milton Road, Cheltenham

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 Manor Court, Swindon Village

item.title: Ineffective temporary traffic lights, 20th October
item.description:
The lights stay red far too long !

item.title: Antique bollard placement - obstruction, 20th October
item.description:
The resident of the house by this bollard is having persistent problems with other people worried about banging their car doors on the bollard when they park, so they park across their driveway or in disabled spaces. The bollard is solid cast iron so a bit of an obstacle, plus it tends to cause people pushing prams or using wheelchairs into the road as pavement width isn't sufficient to accommodate them. Would it be at all possible to relocate this specific bollard and potentially some of the others also causing obstruction? They're heritage so not appropriate to discard but could be used elsewhere in the ward where they wouldn't cause parking or pedestrian issues. Thanks so much!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34 Marle Hill Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard, 20th October
item.description:
This is at the corner of the toddlers' play area. It appears that some grass reinforcement mesh has come above ground level, resulting in a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Hudson Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
